abstract.p: Jung-Tzung Yih letter holds Taiwan should be admitted to World Trade Orgn (Sept 20 article)

block.p: In granting mainland China permanent trade benefits despite its irresponsible behavior (front page, Sept. 20), Washington lawmakers exemplified a quality of true statesmen: knowing when to compromise for long-term benefit.

In granting mainland China permanent trade benefits despite its irresponsible behavior (front page, Sept. 20), Washington lawmakers exemplified a quality of true statesmen: knowing when to compromise for long-term benefit.

The Beijing authorities infrequently exhibit such statesmanship. Their unwillingness to yield on any issue has stagnated relations with Taiwan for years. The two sides have never had interactions free of fear and hostility.

Taiwan is the world's 19th largest economy and has long been qualified to enter the World Trade Organization. As equal members, Taiwan and the mainland would have an opportunity to build mutual trust and nonpolitical bonds through increased trade and communication. Let's hope that Chinese leaders can envision the vast benefits of Taiwan's accession and won't try to delay it any longer.
JUNG-TZUNG YIH Director, Information Division Taipei Economic and Cultural Office New York, Sept. 21, 2000
